FacilityName: Chelford City Regional Wastewater Treatment Plant

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The Chelford City Regional Wastewater Treatment Facility (RWTF) is located in Harris County, Texas and serves the Mission Bend Area.  The RWTF biologically treats and disinfects wastewater prior to discharging to Harris County Flood Control District (HCFCD) ditch D132-00-00, then to Brays Bayou then to the Houston Ship Channel/Buffalo Bayou Tidal in segment No. 1007 of the San Jacinto River Basin.  

     

     The Chelford City RWTF is owned by Chelford City Municipal Utility District (MUD), and operated by Si Environmental LLC (Si), a private company.

     

     The permitted average flow of the treatment plant is 11 MGD.  Treatment operations include mechanical fine screening, complete mix aeration, clarification, disinfection with chlorine, de-chlorination with sulfur dioxide, gravity sludge thickening, aerobic sludge digestion and mechanical dewatering using an onsite belt press.

     

     Chelford City MUD and Si have reviewed their obligations under EPA's Risk Management Program Rule (RMP Rule, Section 112 of the Clean Air Act).  In response to these requirements, Chelford City MUD and Si note the following obligations incumbent on the operations at the chlorine disinfection unit (also referred to as the chlorinator unit) at the RWTF:

(1)    112 (1) - Purpose and General Duty Clause - The essence of the general duty clause is that an owner/operator that stores and uses hazardous chemicals in any quantity has a fundamental obligation to ensure a safe operation, and to have plans in place in the event of an accident to appropriately manage the situation.  Chelford City MUD and Si take this obligation seriously, and intend to be, not only a good neighbor, but also a leader in community safety and emergency preparedness.
